conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from A, B, C, and D through baffles to determine which container E or F each liquid will end up in.
Setup consists of colored blocks at the top releasing liquid, angled baffles, and two containers at the bottom.
Second image shows liquid mid-flow, used to verify reasoning.
Four blocks at the top release liquid: A (orange), B (white), C (blue), D (yellow).
Several angled baffles redirect the liquid: Pink baffle (top left), Green baffle (middle right), Cyan baffle (middle left), White baffle (bottom right).
Two containers at the bottom: E (red, left), F (cyan, right).
Liquid flows downward due to gravity, baffles redirect path based on angles.
A is the leftmost block.
Orange liquid falls straight down and hits the cyan baffle.
Cyan baffle redirects the liquid to the right.
Liquid continues downward and slightly to the right, hits red container E.
Orange liquid from A flows into container E.
B is second from the left.
White liquid falls straight down and hits the pink baffle.
Pink baffle redirects the liquid to the right.
Liquid continues downward and to the right, hits white baffle.
White baffle redirects the liquid to the left.
Liquid falls into red container E.
White liquid from B flows into container E.
C is third from the left.
Blue liquid falls straight down and hits the pink baffle.
Pink baffle redirects the liquid to the right.
Liquid continues downward and to the right, hits green baffle.
Green baffle redirects the liquid to the left.
